bill.title: An act relating to miscellaneous amendments to election law
bill.description: An act relating to miscellaneous amendments to election law

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Placed on Calendar for Notice on March 13, 2015
Rep. Cole of Burlington moved to postpone action until March 18, 2015 which was agreed to
Read Second Time
Rep. Cole of Burlington spoke for the committee on Government Operations
Rep. Cole of Burlington moved to amend the bill
Which was agreed to
Third Reading Ordered
Read Third time
Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Government Operations
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Government Operations
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Government Operations
Reported favorably by Senator White for Committee on Government Operations with proposal of amendment
Point of order raised by Senator(s) Sears
Point of order overruled by the President
Question divided on demand of Senator Sears
Committee on Government Operations FIRST recommendation of amendment agreed to
Senator(s) Sears motion to amend Committee on Government Operations proposal of amendment; text
Motion to amend by Senator(s) Sears disagreed to on division Yeas 10, Nays 17
Committee on Government Operations SECOND proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call requested by Senator Sears, Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 22, Nays = 6
3rd reading ordered
New Business/Third Reading
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Senate message passed in Concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rep. Cole of Burlington moved to postpone action until May 11, 2015 which was agreed to
Rep. Cole of Burlington moved to postpone action until May 12, 2015 which was agreed to
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Cole of Burlington
Speaker appointed Cole of Burlington, Martin of Wolcott and Higley of Lowell as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
House message House refused to concur in Senate proposal of amendment & requested Conference Committee; House Conference Committee members appointed
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators White, Benning, and Pollina
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Baruth
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Campbell
Committee of Conference report submitted by Senator White for Committee, text
Committee of Conference report adopted
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Savage of Swanton
Committee of Conference report agreed to (House bill)
Signed by Governor on May 26, 2015

votes.desc: Committee on Government Operations SECOND proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call requested by Senator Sears, Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 22, Nays = 6
